thread.title: Is George Michael's funeral today? Cemetery prepares to lay star to rest next to beloved mum
thread.title_full: Is George Michael's funeral today? Cemetery prepares to lay star to rest next to beloved mum

author: Emmeline Saunders
title: Is George Michael's funeral today? Cemetery prepares to lay star to rest next to beloved mum
text:
Is George Michael's funeral today? Cemetery prepares to lay star to rest next to beloved mum A sign at Highgate Cemetery appears to hint that George will be buried today Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Fans have been speculating about it for the last few weeks, but it looks like George Michael's funeral could finally take place today. 
The Careless Whispers star will be laid to rest at Highgate Cemetery in north London, in a plot next to his beloved mum Lesley. 
While the funeral service will be a private one for close friends and family of the star, fans have been gathering to see if they can get one last glimpse of their idol before he is buried. 
A sign has been put up at Highgate asking visitors to keep noise to a minimum and to refrain from taking personal photos while a funeral takes place today. George died on December 25th 2016 - nearly three months ago (Photo: PA) A sign has gone up at Highgate Cemetery this morning (Photo: FameFlynet UK Tel : +44 (0)20 3551 5049 Email : info@fameflynet.uk.com) Highgate is where George's mother is buried (Photo: FameFlynet UK Tel : +44 (0)20 3551 5049 Email : info@fameflynet.uk.com) The funeral is being kept private for George's family and close friends (Photo: FameFlynet UK Tel : +44 (0)20 3551 5049 Email : info@fameflynet.uk.com) 
While there's been no confirmation that the funeral is George's, witnesses have noticed the plot next to Lesley's has been cleared. 
Security has been ramped up as staff prepare the grave, which has been cleared of its undergrowth and spruced up, and is surrounded by pots of yellow daffodils. 
"Lesley was George's world so it is fitting that they should now be together," a source told the Sunday Mirror . The grave of George Michael's mum (Photo: Mirrorpix) Highgate Cemetery has asked visitors to keep the noise down (Photo: FameFlynet UK Tel : +44 (0)20 3551 5049 Email : info@fameflynet.uk.com) He'll be laid to rest next to Lesley, as she was "his world" (Photo: FameFlynet UK Tel : +44 (0)20 3551 5049 Email : info@fameflynet.uk.com) 
It comes at a particularly poignant time of the year given that Mothering Sunday takes place in less than two weeks - something the family may well have considered when they were planning their final tribute to George. 
According to the Daily Star , staff are keeping 24-hour surveillance as fans continue to pay tribute. 
George's close friend Kate Moss was called back from her planned trip to India just minutes before she was due to board the plane to New Delhi. 
She'd reportedly been given the funeral details on Thursday and had to beg staff in Heathrow's First Class lounge to remove her luggage from the plane. Fans have been leaving their own tributes at the site (Photo: MH14) They've been remembering George in their own way (Photo: MH14) A tree has been adorned with pictures and messages for the icon (Photo: MH14) In the absence of a public funeral, fans have had to say goodbye in other ways (Photo: MH14) A heartfelt tribute to George - or Yog, as some of his fans called him (Photo: MH14) Hand-made cards have been planted in among the spring flowers (Photo: MH14) 
It comes as George's lover Fadi Fawaz claimed the bereaved family have reached out to him to mend their relationship in the days before the funeral. 
Fadi praised the move as "something nice" as he shared kind comments thought to have been written in a letter by one of George's relatives. Read More
